meta.title: Contribute
meta.description: Learn how to contribute to Dev Showcase — project history, standards, workflow and contributors.

hero.title: Built by the community, for the community
hero.description: Dev Showcase is an open source platform that combines a professional portfolio with real technical content. Any developer can contribute with guides, tools and improvements.

history.title: From an idea to a platform
history.description: What started as a personal portfolio became a full platform for the dev community — all in a few days.

day1.title: First commit
day1.description: The idea was born: create more than a portfolio — a content platform for devs.

day2.title: Portfolio + AI Chat
day2.description: Full landing page with hero, projects, experience and chatbot integrated with GPT-4.1.

day3.title: Guides and tools
day3.description: 8 technical guides, AI Code Reviewer, Regex Playground and internationalization in 4 languages.

day4.title: Quality and infrastructure
day4.description: CI/CD with GitHub Actions, Husky, commitlint, full accessibility and documentation.

day5.title: Platform goes live
day5.description: Production deploy, branch protection, Git Flow and opening for community contributions.

whatYouCanDo.title: What you can do
whatYouCanDo.description: There are many ways to contribute, regardless of your experience level.

guides.title: Create guides
guides.description: Write technical guides on any topic — React, Node, DevOps, testing and more.

tools.title: Create tools
tools.description: Build interactive tools like editors, playgrounds and analyzers.

improve.title: Improve existing
improve.description: Refactor code, fix bugs, improve UX or add features.

translations.title: Translations
translations.description: Help translate to new languages or improve existing translations.

docs.title: Documentation
docs.description: Improve documentation, add examples or create tutorials.

howItWorks.title: How it works
howItWorks.description: The contribution process is simple and follows the open source standard.

fork.title: Fork the repository
fork.description: Create a copy of the project in your GitHub account.

develop.title: Develop
develop.description: Follow project standards: i18n, accessibility and tests.

pr.title: Open a PR
pr.description: Submit your Pull Request to the develop branch.

review.title: Review and merge
review.description: After approval, your code goes live on the platform.

standards.title: Project standards
standards.description: We follow conventions that keep code organized and accessible.

commits.title: Conventional Commits
commits.description: feat:, fix:, docs: — standardized commit messages.

structure.title: Folder structure
structure.description: features/ for domains, components/ for reusables.

i18n.title: Internationalization
i18n.description: All visible text uses i18n. pt-BR is the source of truth.

a11y.title: Accessibility
a11y.description: ARIA roles, focus trap, keyboard navigation and skip links.

quality.title: Quality
quality.description: ESLint, Prettier, strict TypeScript and tests with Vitest.

contributors.title: Contributors
contributors.description: People who helped build this platform.
contributors.beFirstDescription: The platform just opened for contributions. How about being the first?

cta.title: Ready to contribute?
cta.description: Explore the code, pick an issue or create something new. Every contribution is welcome.

explore.title: Explore the platform
explore.description: Learn about the architecture, components, APIs and standards that make the project work.

platformStats.title: The platform in numbers
platformStats.description: Real data updated automatically. Every visit counts.
platformStats.noData: Metrics will appear with the first visits.
